Backstories: Grew up on a farm raising animals
Owns the best cleaver in town, passed down for generations
Knows secret family recipes that people travel miles to taste
Wants to open a restaurant in the capital someday
Once cooked for royalty who visited the village
Learned butchery after a great famine taught them to waste nothing
Apprenticed under a legendary butcher who served nobility
Discovered a unique preservation method during a particularly harsh winter
Traveled to distant lands to learn exotic meat preparation techniques
Survived by hunting and processing game during a time of exile
Won a regional meat festival competition with an unusual cut
Inherited a secret spice blend that makes their products distinctive
Rescued the village's meat supply during a flood by quick thinking
Formerly a vegetarian who had a life-changing experience with properly prepared meat
Developed special techniques for using every part of the animal after witnessing waste
Raised by a family that supplied meat to healing houses, learning medicinal properties
Discovered ancient butchery techniques in old scrolls
Pioneered a humane slaughter method now adopted by others
Goals: To create a new signature dish
To open a chain of meat shops
To pass down their recipes to a worthy successor
To discover the perfect balance of spices for each cut
To create a butchery guild that maintains quality standards
To breed animals with exceptional flavor profiles
To write the definitive book on meat preparation
To develop preservation techniques that extend shelf life naturally
To host a feast that brings together the entire community

To discover new flavor combinations that revolutionize traditional dishes

Fears: Being outdone by a younger butcher
Their knives becoming dull at a critical moment
Forgetting crucial steps in a complex recipe
Disrespectful treatment of animals before slaughter
Losing their sense of smell or taste
Customers not appreciating the craft involved
Running out of specific spices essential to their signature flavors
Their children having no interest in continuing the family trade
Being forced to compromise quality for quantity
Quirks: Names each animal before processing it
Can tell how an animal lived by tasting its meat
Refuses to work with dull knives, sharpening obsessively
Follows specific rituals before making the first cut
Talks to the meat while preparing it
Wears a specific lucky apron that's never been washed
Can identify cuts of meat blindfolded just by touch
Keeps a journal of every exceptional animal processed
Has a specific knife for each type of cut
Refuses to work during certain moon phases
Collects bones in specific patterns for good luck
Measures ingredients by hand rather than with tools
Tastes raw meat to judge quality (safely)
Hangs herbs in specific arrangements around their shop
Carves decorative patterns into certain cuts
Saves a small portion of each animal as an offering
SpeechPatterns: Describes everything in terms of cuts of meat
Speaks with rhythmic chops like a cleaver on a block
Uses butchery terms for everyday situations
Punctuates sentences with hand gestures mimicking cutting
Speaks bluntly and directly, like a clean cut
Describes flavors with elaborate, poetic detail
Lowers voice when sharing secret recipes or techniques
Tends to list ingredients when explaining anything
Speaks loudly as if calling across a busy market
Uses different tones when discussing different meats
Peppers speech with old butchers' sayings
Describes people in terms of what cut they'd be
Speaks precisely, measuring words like ingredients

Carries the subtle scent of smoke and spices
Has a distinctive butcher's callus on their thumb
Moves with surprising grace and precision
Wears clothes with faint bloodstains that never quite wash out
Has exceptionally clean, well-maintained nails despite their work
Skin on hands toughened from hot water and handling meat
Distinctive tan line from their apron
Muscular shoulders from hanging and moving carcasses
Eyes that constantly assess and evaluate, as if judging cuts
Carries themselves with the confidence of someone who handles sharp tools daily

Competitive but respectful toward other food artisans
Generous with food but guarded with techniques
Protective of customers' health above all else

Treats regular customers like extended family

Remembers everyone by their favorite cut or preparation
